page.title: 09ALMHOUSES - BUILDING
page.content: The almshouses were built 1839 and became listed in 1973. They are owned by a group of trustees one of whom must be the Vicar of Wadsley Church. The almshouses are in the grounds of the church near an old school and a graveyard. There are 6 houses all in a row. All the almshouses are very small. Wadsley Church has always controlled the almshouses and the people who inhabit them. There is always a waiting list of 3-4 people. To be eligible for an almshouse you have to be a widow, over 60, and a pensioner. In the midle of the houses is a plaque and it says;'Thus saith the Lord, 'And even to your old age I am here'' -ISIAH
